page.title: 02The Gypsy Queen
page.content: {The Gypsy Queen }died in 1740 and is buried in St Georges Churchyard in Beckenham.She was buried in a special coffin because she could not be straightened.She had always sat in a crouched position, with her knees tucked under her chin. Local publicans paid for her funeral because they had benefited from the flocks of people who came to see this ancient old woman of 93 years.After her death her body lay in state on { {Penge Common},which was the home for many Gypsies and their brightly painted caravans.
